decks.notes: The deck focuses on using Underworld Breach to continuously cast spells from the graveyard, enabling powerful combos and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Urza's Saga, the deck aims to set up a loop with Grinding Station to mill the opponent or to win with Thassa's Oracle. With the help of Mox Amber and Mox Opal for ramp, the deck can quickly assemble its pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful synergies and recursive plays.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through counterspells, removal spells, and graveyard hate, while also utilizing card draw and graveyard recursion to maintain card advantage. The creatures included provide additional control elements and a win condition with Murktide Regent. The mana base is streamlined to support the control strategy, with a mix of fetchlands and dual lands. Overall, the deck aims to control the game tempo and outvalue the opponent through efficient spell interaction and resource management.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressively playing quick creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The deck also utilizes burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Lightning Bolt to control the board and chip away at the opponent's life total. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides additional creature support, while cards like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison provide extra reach and disruption. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and solid board presence, ultimately sealing the game with powerful finishers like Seasoned Pyromancer and Guide of Souls.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse to cast large Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. The deck also includes control elements like Kozilek's Return and Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The combination of ramp and control allows the deck to overwhelm opponents with powerful Eldrazi creatures while maintaining control of the game. The deck also includes utility lands like Bojuka Bog and Cavern of Souls to further support its strategy.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a combination of counterspells, removal, and hand disruption spells. The deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent through efficient removal like Fatal Push and Counterspell, while also utilizing powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog to close out the game. The deck's mana base is carefully balanced to allow for consistent casting of spells and powerful threats, ensuring that the control player can maintain control of the game until victory is achieved.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to maintain control over the game through a combination of countering spells, removing threats with cards like Fatal Push and Abhorrent Oculus, and disrupting opponents' plans with cards like Thought Scour and Sink into Stupor. The deck's win condition revolves around using powerful finishers like Murktide Regent and Harbinger of the Seas to close out the game. With a mix of disruption, removal, and finishers, this deck aims to outlast opponents and secure victory through careful manipulation of the game state.
